Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2016 10:30AM Countrygirl91678 wrote: I am 3 1/2 months from Last chemo and I have a head full of hair! Once it starts about 6 weeks it grows back really fast. I had some graying before but after it grew back it was solid white. My hairstylist says chemo can change the pigmentation and the texture
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2018 09:04PM Countrygirl80 wrote: I too had these - was mid-Herceptin. My MO was certain that it was a pinched nerve and that it would most likely correct itself. I had a massage and chiro adjustment and it went away. But, not without lots of worrying on my end!
Posts.Title: Head pain NTS VL22

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2017 08:38AM Countrygirl80 wrote: My heart sank to read your most recent post. I can honestly say I know how you feel, as I was diagnosed with IDC when my son was just 4 months old. I see you live in Ohio - so do I. If you aren't already, I encourage you to doctor with either the Stefanie Spielman Center (part of the James at OSU) or the Cleveland Clinic - or at least get a second opinion from one of them. Triple negative doesn't have as many treatment options as other subtypes, but it is still certainly curable. The larger cancer centers will know the most effective way to stop it. You will need lots of help with your little one - treatment is no fun. But, you WILL get through it. Take it one day at a time. It will get better. I promise. Feel free to message me with any other questions. Big hugs to you as you start this journey. It's just not fair

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2015 12:29PM Countrygirl1225 wrote: Okay, just started on infusion with Doxil. Xeloda stopped working for me and that was pill form. Have some bloating going on and free floating nausea -  Yes I too get scared of the unknown - glad I am still working Office workers and my bosses are very supportive with me. They are my second family. We can live only one day at a time. Try not to worry - all your feels are normal. I am at work now and took some time on this site. It helps me to hear others and their fears or good news.

Posts.Content: Mar 6, 2017 09:53PM Countrygirl80 wrote: Just saying hi to a fellow Buckeye...! Sorry for what brings you here, but I'm glad you've found it. I was 35 at diagnosis - my youngest child was just 4 months and my oldest was 7. Last year was extremely tough and trying (emotionally and physically). But, we all made it through. And so will you. Where do you doctor? I go to the Stefanie Spielman Center at the James...it's a little haul, but well worth it. Best of luck starting chemo.
